hc.server.ui

Class ScriptPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • hc.server.ui.ScriptPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ScriptPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    ScriptPanel is JComponent to load JavaScript and execute JavaScript.

    a ScriptPanel can be used in HTMLMlet and Dialog like JPanel.

    Important :
    permission of ScriptPanel is required for project.
    Since:
    7.36
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • executeScript

        public void executeScript(java.lang.String script)
        execute script on current ScriptPanel.

        in general, please initialize this panel by setInnerHTML(String) and loadScript(String) first.

        to receive event of input in panel, please overrides onEvent(String, String, String[]).

        Warning : all id of elements of HTML created by server is begin with 'HC'.

        Important :
        permission of ScriptPanel is required for project.
        Parameters:
        script -
        Since:
        7.36
        See Also:
        loadScript(String), setInnerHTML(String), onEvent(String, String, String[])

      • loadScript

        public void loadScript(java.lang.String script)
        load script for current ScriptPanel.
        it is full script, HTML (<script type="text/javascript">) can NOT be included.

        Warning :
        1. window.onload will NOT be triggered, please invoke it by executeScript(String)
        2. all id of elements of HTML created by server is begin with 'HC'.

        Important :
        permission of ScriptPanel is required for project.

        About cache :
        don't worry about script too large for re-translating to mobile,
        the cache subsystem of HomeCenter will intelligence analysis to determine whether transmission or loading cache from mobile (if script is too small, it will not be cached). What you should do is put more into one script, because if there is too much pieces of cache in a project, the system will automatically clear the cache and restart caching.

        to disable cache for current script, see loadScript(String, boolean).
        Parameters:
        script -
        Since:
        7.36

      • loadScript

        public void loadScript(java.lang.String script,
              boolean enableCache)
        load script for current ScriptPanel.
        it is full script, HTML (<script type="text/javascript">) can NOT be included.

        Warning :
        1. window.onload will NOT be triggered, please invoke it by executeScript(String)
        2. all id of elements of HTML created by server is begin with 'HC'.
        Parameters:
        script -
        enableCache - true means this script may be cached if it is too large.
        See Also:
        loadScript(String)

      • onEvent

        public boolean onEvent(java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String action,
              java.lang.String[] values)
        for example, a inner HTML is following :

        <button id='mybutton' onclick="javascript:window.hcserver.click('mybutton');" />

        when user click the button, the event will be dispatched to this method,
        the parameter of id is 'mybutton' and parameter of action is CLICK.

        Warning : all id of elements of HTML created by server is begin with 'HC'.

        Note :
        if there is more than one ScriptPanels in a Dialog or HTMLMlet, the events of other ScriptPanel may be dispatched to this method, you should return false to tell server that the event is NOT for current ScriptPanel.

        Table of Actions (NOT all)

        Reference HTML TagReference EventJavaScript APIAction
        buttononclickwindow.hcserver.click(id); CLICK
        input type='checkbox'onclickwindow.hcserver.click(id); CLICK
        input type='radio'onclickwindow.hcserver.click(id); CLICK
        selectonchange window.hcserver.change(id, document.getElementById(id).selectedIndex); CHANGE
        input type='range'onchange window.hcserver.change(id, intValue); CHANGE
        input type='text'|'password'onblur window.hcserver.notify(id, text); NOTIFY
        textareaonblur window.hcserver.notify(id, text); NOTIFY
        div | canvasmousedown window.hcserver.mousePressed(id, e.offsetX, e.offsetY); MOUSE_PRESSED
        div | canvasmouseup window.hcserver.mouseReleased(id, e.offsetX, e.offsetY); MOUSE_RELEASED
        div | canvasmouseleave window.hcserver.mouseExited(id, e.offsetX, e.offsetY); MOUSE_EXITED
        div | canvasmouseenter window.hcserver.mouseEntered(id, e.offsetX, e.offsetY); MOUSE_ENTERED
        div | canvasclick window.hcserver.mouseClicked(id, e.offsetX, e.offsetY); MOUSE_CLICKED
        div | canvastouchmove window.hcserver.mouseDragged(id, e.touches[0].clientX - leftDiv, e.touches[0].clientY - topDiv); MOUSE_DRAGGED
        Parameters:
        id -
        action - one of following (not all) :
        CLICK, CHANGE, NOTIFY, MOUSE_CLICKED, MOUSE_DRAGGED, MOUSE_ENTERED, MOUSE_EXITED, MOUSE_PRESSED, MOUSE_RELEASED.
        values -
        Returns:
        true means the event is consumed; false means the event will be dispatched to other ScriptPanel.
        Since:
        7.36

      • setInnerHTML

        public void setInnerHTML(java.lang.String html)
        set inner HTML for current ScriptPanel.

        for example :
        1. a JPanel will be translated to <div id='HC_*'></div>,
        2. when invoke setInnerHTML("<div id='myScriptDiv'>some canvas html</div>"),
        3. then the result is : <div id='HC_*'><div id='myScriptDiv'>some canvas html</div></div>

        Warning : all id of elements of HTML created by server is begin with 'HC'.

        Note : there is maybe more ScriptPanels in a Dialog or HTMLMlet, make sure that IDs are unique among them.

        About cache :
        don't worry about inner HTML too large for re-translating to mobile,
        the cache subsystem of HomeCenter will intelligence analysis to determine whether transmission or loading cache from mobile (if inner HTML is too small, it will not be cached). If there is too much pieces of cache in a project, system will automatically clear the cache and restart caching.

        to disable cache for current HTML, see setInnerHTML(String, boolean).
        Parameters:
        html - the inner HTML, for example : <div id='myScriptDiv'>some canvas html</div>
        Since:
        7.36
        See Also:
        HTMLMlet.setCSS(javax.swing.JComponent, String, String)

      • setInnerHTML

        public void setInnerHTML(java.lang.String html,
                boolean enableCache)
        set inner HTML for current ScriptPanel.
        Parameters:
        html -
        enableCache - true means this HTML may be cached if it is too large.
        See Also:
        setInnerHTML(String)
